newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Feedlot Assn files meat dumping suit - media.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Feedlot Assn files meat dumping suit - media.

text.p: Mexico's Feedlot Association has filed a suit accusing meat exporters of dumping product on the Mexican market, media sources said Tuesday.

The suit, which had been much awaited and had been under preparation for several months, accuses exporters, mostly from the United States, of dumping meat at prices below production cost or below levels in the country of export.
State news agency Notimex cited Jesus Vizcarra Calderon, the association's president, from the northwestern city of Culiacan as saying the suit had been presented to the Trade Ministry.
Radio network Radio Red also said the suit had now been filed, although spokesmen for the association and the Trade Ministry were not immediately available for comment.
Association director general Enrique Lopez told Reuters in February the dumping suit was in the pipeline and would be filed early this year.
